description: From Middle English foman (“an enemy, devil, demon”), from Old English fāhman (“enemy”), equivalent to foe +‎ man.

entries.meaning: (archaic) An enemy; a foe in battle; an armed or unarmed adversary; a demon
examples: ‘I count no day as lived unless I have loved a woman, slain a foeman, and eaten a fine meal...and the days that I have lived are as numberless as the stars in the sky.’
